verses.verse: Now Pashur <S%H6583><s%> the son <S%H1121><s%> of Immer <S%H564><s%> the priest <S%H3548><s%>, who was also chief <S%H6496><s%> governor <S%H5057><s%> in the house <S%H1004><s%> of the Lord <S%H3068><s%>, heard <S%H8085><s%> that Jeremiah <S%H3414><s%> prophesied <S%H5012><s%> these things <S%H1697><s%>.

Then Pashur <S%H6583><s%> struck <S%H5221><s%> Jeremiah <S%H3414><s%> the prophet <S%H5030><s%>, and put <S%H5414><s%> him in the stocks <S%H4115><s%> that were in the high <S%H5945><s%> gate <S%H8179><s%> of Benjamin <S%H1144><s%>, which was by the house <S%H1004><s%> of the Lord <S%H3068><s%>.

And it came to pass on the next day <S%H4283><s%>, that Pashur <S%H6583><s%> brought forth <S%H3318><s%> Jeremiah <S%H3414><s%> out of the stocks <S%H4115><s%>. Then said <S%H559><s%> Jeremiah <S%H3414><s%> unto him <S%H3068><s%>, The Lord has not called <S%H7121><s%> your name <S%H8034><s%> Pashur <S%H6583><s%>, but Magor <S%H4036><s%>â€“missabib.

For thus says <S%H559><s%> the Lord <S%H3068><s%>, Behold <S%H5414><s%>, I will make you a terror <S%H4032><s%> to yourself <S%H157><s%>, and to all your friends: and they shall fall <S%H5307><s%> by the sword <S%H2719><s%> of their enemies <S%H341><s%>, and your eyes <S%H5869><s%> shall behold <S%H7200><s%> it <S%H5414><s%>: and I will give all Judah <S%H3063><s%> into the hand <S%H3027><s%> of the king <S%H4428><s%> of Babylon <S%H894><s%>, and he shall carry them captive <S%H1540><s%> into Babylon <S%H894><s%>, and shall kill <S%H5221><s%> them with the sword <S%H2719><s%>.

Moreover I will deliver <S%H5414><s%> all the strength <S%H2633><s%> of this city <S%H5892><s%>, and all the labors <S%H3018><s%> there <S%H3366><s%>, and all the precious things there <S%H214><s%>, and all the treasures of the kings <S%H4428><s%> of Judah <S%H3063><s%> will I give <S%H5414><s%> into the hand <S%H3027><s%> of their enemies <S%H341><s%>, which shall plunder <S%H962><s%> them <S%H3947><s%>, and take them <S%H935><s%>, and carry them to Babylon <S%H894><s%>.

And you <S%H6583><s%>, Pashur, and all that live <S%H3427><s%> in your house <S%H1004><s%> shall go <S%H3212><s%> into captivity <S%H7628><s%>: and you shall come <S%H935><s%> to Babylon <S%H894><s%>, and there you shall die <S%H4191><s%>, and shall be buried <S%H6912><s%> there <S%H157><s%>, you, and all your friends, to whom you have prophesied <S%H5012><s%> lies <S%H8267><s%>.

O Lord <S%H3068><s%>, you have deceived <S%H6601><s%> me <S%H6601><s%>, and I was deceived: you are stronger <S%H2388><s%> than I <S%H3201><s%>, and have prevailed: I am in derision <S%H7814><s%> daily <S%H3117><s%>, every one mocks me <S%H3932><s%>.

For since <S%H1767><s%> I spoke <S%H1696><s%>, I cried out <S%H2199><s%>, I cried <S%H7121><s%> violence <S%H2555><s%> and plunder <S%H7701><s%>; because the word <S%H1697><s%> of the Lord <S%H3068><s%> was made a reproach <S%H2781><s%> unto me <S%H7047><s%>, and a derision, daily <S%H3117><s%>.

Then I said <S%H559><s%>, I will not make mention <S%H2142><s%> of him <S%H1696><s%>, nor speak any more in his name <S%H8034><s%>. But his word was in my heart <S%H3820><s%> as a burning <S%H1197><s%> fire <S%H784><s%> shut up <S%H6113><s%> in my bones <S%H6106><s%>, and I was weary <S%H3811><s%> with forbearing <S%H3557><s%>, and I could not stay <S%H3201><s%>.

For I heard <S%H8085><s%> the defaming <S%H1681><s%> of many <S%H7227><s%>, fear <S%H4032><s%> on every side <S%H5439><s%>. Report <S%H5046><s%>, say they <S%H5046><s%>, and we will report it <S%H582><s%>. All my familiars watched <S%H8104><s%> for my halting <S%H6763><s%>, saying <S%H6601><s%>, Perhaps he will be enticed, and we shall prevail <S%H3201><s%> against him <S%H3947><s%>, and we shall take our revenge on him <S%H5360><s%>.

But the Lord <S%H3068><s%> is with me as a mighty <S%H1368><s%> terrible one <S%H6184><s%>: therefore my persecutors <S%H7291><s%> shall stumble <S%H3782><s%>, and they shall not prevail <S%H3201><s%>: they shall be greatly <S%H3966><s%> ashamed <S%H954><s%>; for they shall not prosper <S%H7919><s%>: their everlasting <S%H5769><s%> confusion <S%H3639><s%> shall never be forgotten <S%H7911><s%>.

But <S%H3068><s%>, O Lord of hosts <S%H6635><s%>, that test <S%H974><s%> the righteous <S%H6662><s%>, and see <S%H7200><s%> the minds <S%H3629><s%> and the heart <S%H3820><s%>, let me see <S%H7200><s%> your vengeance <S%H5360><s%> on them <S%H1540><s%>: for unto you have I opened my cause <S%H7379><s%>.

Sing <S%H7891><s%> unto the Lord <S%H3068><s%>, praise <S%H1984><s%> you the Lord <S%H3068><s%>: for he has delivered <S%H5337><s%> the soul <S%H5315><s%> of the poor <S%H34><s%> from the hand <S%H3027><s%> of evildoers <S%H7489><s%>.
Cursed <S%H779><s%> be the day <S%H3117><s%> where I was born <S%H3205><s%>: let not the day <S%H3117><s%> where my mother <S%H517><s%> bore <S%H3205><s%> me be blessed <S%H1288><s%>.

Cursed <S%H779><s%> be the man <S%H376><s%> who brought news <S%H1319><s%> to my father <S%H1><s%>, saying <S%H559><s%>, A man <S%H2145><s%> child <S%H1121><s%> is born <S%H3205><s%> unto you <S%H8055><s%>; making him very glad <S%H8055><s%>.

And let that man <S%H376><s%> be as the cities <S%H5892><s%> which the Lord <S%H3068><s%> overthrew <S%H2015><s%>, and repented <S%H5162><s%> not <S%H8085><s%>: and let him hear the cry <S%H2201><s%> in the morning <S%H1242><s%>, and the shouting <S%H8643><s%> at noontide <S%H6256><s%>;

Because he killed <S%H4191><s%> me not from the womb <S%H7358><s%>; or that my mother <S%H517><s%> might have been my grave <S%H6913><s%>, and her womb <S%H7358><s%> to be always <S%H5769><s%> great with me <S%H2030><s%>.

Therefore came I forth <S%H3318><s%> out of the womb <S%H7358><s%> to see <S%H7200><s%> labor <S%H5999><s%> and sorrow <S%H3015><s%>, that my days <S%H3117><s%> should be consumed <S%H3615><s%> with shame <S%H1322><s%>?
